domande.sql: SELECT domande.id, domande.specie, domande.data, "tipiDomanda".descrizione AS tipo, autori.descrizione AS autore, livelli.descrizione AS livello FROM domande JOIN "tipiDomanda" ON domande.tipo = "tipiDomanda".id JOIN autori ON domande.autore = autori.id JOIN livelli ON domande.livello = livelli.id WHERE domande.attiva = 1 AND domande.lingua = '1' AND domande.livello = 2 AND domande.specie = 7 AND (domande.tipo = 4 OR domande.tipo = 5 OR domande.tipo = 6 OR domande.tipo = 7 OR domande.tipo = 8 OR domande.tipo = 9 OR domande.tipo = 10 OR domande.tipo = 11 OR domande.tipo = 12 OR domande.tipo = 17 OR domande.tipo = 18 OR domande.tipo = 19 OR domande.tipo = 20 OR domande.tipo = 21 OR domande.tipo = 22 OR domande.tipo = 23 OR domande.tipo = 24 OR domande.tipo = 25) AND domande.specializzazione = 1 ORDER BY rand() LIMIT 2

domandariempimentotesto.testo: Let me show you our holiday photos!  OK, so these are from last August, ___1___ we were in the Hebrides.  Look, this is my sister Sarah, ___2___ you already know, in fact, because you met her at Sandra%u2019s party last year.   And this one shows the very nice hotel ___3___ we stayed.  And this one is a photo of Farnley Island, __4__ is one of the nicest places I%u2019ve ever seen.

It was only the other day that I thought about how ____1____ water we use each day. Sometimes I think we waste ____2____ water without realising it. In developing nations, people don't even have water in their homes and have to walk ____3____ miles to reach a water-well. Sometimes there is _____4_____ water in the well because it doesn't rain often. I think we often forget how lucky we really are.

domande.sql: SELECT domande.id, domande.specie, domande.data, "tipiDomanda".descrizione AS tipo, autori.descrizione AS autore, livelli.descrizione AS livello FROM domande JOIN "tipiDomanda" ON domande.tipo = "tipiDomanda".id JOIN autori ON domande.autore = autori.id JOIN livelli ON domande.livello = livelli.id WHERE domande.attiva = 1 AND domande.lingua = '1' AND (domande.id NOT IN (3269, 6672)) AND domande.livello = 2 AND domande.specie = 1 AND (domande.tipo = 4 OR domande.tipo = 5 OR domande.tipo = 6 OR domande.tipo = 7 OR domande.tipo = 8 OR domande.tipo = 9 OR domande.tipo = 10 OR domande.tipo = 11 OR domande.tipo = 12 OR domande.tipo = 17 OR domande.tipo = 18 OR domande.tipo = 19 OR domande.tipo = 20 OR domande.tipo = 21 OR domande.tipo = 22 OR domande.tipo = 23 OR domande.tipo = 24 OR domande.tipo = 25 OR domande.tipo = 26) AND domande.specializzazione = 1 ORDER BY rand() LIMIT 8

domandasceltasingola.testo: _____ about three hundred people queuing for tickets.
There are three __________________ in the library.
"Are you ____________ to Florence with us tomorrow?" "Yes, I am".
Today is Wednesday so tomorrow is___________.
They have three ________________________ - two boys and a girl.

domande.sql: SELECT domande.id, domande.specie, domande.data, "tipiDomanda".descrizione AS tipo, autori.descrizione AS autore, livelli.descrizione AS livello FROM domande JOIN "tipiDomanda" ON domande.tipo = "tipiDomanda".id JOIN autori ON domande.autore = autori.id JOIN livelli ON domande.livello = livelli.id WHERE domande.attiva = 1 AND domande.lingua = '1' AND (domande.id NOT IN (3269, 6672, 7130, 7288, 6894, 7223, 7043, 7196, 6880, 6912)) AND domande.livello = 2 AND domande.specie = 5 AND domande.tipo = 28 AND domande.specializzazione = 1 ORDER BY rand() LIMIT 1

domandaabbinamentosingolo.prologo: Abbina ad ogni immagine una sola descrizione trascinandola col mouse.

domande.sql: SELECT domande.id, domande.specie, domande.data, "tipiDomanda".descrizione AS tipo, autori.descrizione AS autore, livelli.descrizione AS livello FROM domande JOIN "tipiDomanda" ON domande.tipo = "tipiDomanda".id JOIN autori ON domande.autore = autori.id JOIN livelli ON domande.livello = livelli.id WHERE domande.attiva = 1 AND domande.lingua = '1' AND (domande.id NOT IN (3269, 6672, 7130, 7288, 6894, 7223, 7043, 7196, 6880, 6912, 6462)) AND domande.livello = 2 AND domande.specie = 1 AND domande.tipo = 1 AND domande.specializzazione = 1 ORDER BY rand() LIMIT 3

risposte.risposta: Some of our tickets are cheaper today.
There are only ten tickets left.
You should put your litter in the dustbins.
Do not put litter in the dustbins.
You can take litter from the dustbins.
There is only hot food here.
It is more expensive to eat inside.

domande.sql: SELECT domande.id, domande.specie, domande.data, "tipiDomanda".descrizione AS tipo, autori.descrizione AS autore, livelli.descrizione AS livello FROM domande JOIN "tipiDomanda" ON domande.tipo = "tipiDomanda".id JOIN autori ON domande.autore = autori.id JOIN livelli ON domande.livello = livelli.id WHERE domande.attiva = 1 AND domande.lingua = '1' AND (domande.id NOT IN (3269, 6672, 7130, 7288, 6894, 7223, 7043, 7196, 6880, 6912, 6462, 11626, 3171, 4068)) AND domande.livello = 2 AND domande.specie = 2 AND domande.tipo = 1 AND domande.specializzazione = 1 ORDER BY rand() LIMIT 1

domandacomprensionetesto.prologo: Leggi il testo e rispondi alle 5 domande cliccando sull'opzione corretta.
domandacomprensionetesto.testo_comprensione:
Young at Heart

As you become older, the rights that the law gives you increase. But the ages at which you gain these rights can vary widely from country to country. There are even big differences between what young people can do in England and in Scotland.
Because young people mature at different speeds, and become "responsible" according to their own personality and background, there is no universally agreed age at which they become adults. That is why - according to the Children's Legal Centre, in London, which collected these figures - the minimum age limits are often arbitrary.
The most important age from a legal point of view is called the age of majority. This is the age at which the law considers you to have rights and responsibilities, and at which you can take all decisions that affect your life.
The most common age for this in Europe is 18. It was 21 in England and Wales until 1969, but it then came down to 18 - since which time many other European countries have followed. In France and West Germany, for instance, the age came down from 21 to 18 in 1974, and in Italy the following year.
In Greece, Ireland, Holland and Denmark the age has also been reduced to 18 - often in response to young people's demands. In Austria it is 19 and in Switzerland, 20.
In many countries young people reach the age of majority earlier if they have been "emancipated", or free from all parental control. This might happen on marriage, or at the request of the young person and a parent or guardian.

domandasceltasingola.testo: 'The rights that the law gives you increase'  (first line) means that you have
The most important age from the legal point of view is when you
In some European countries majority was reached at
The age of majority came down from 21 to 18 in 1974

risposte.risposta: in France, West Germany and Italy

domandasceltasingola.testo: Young people who have been "emancipated" refers in the text to young people who

risposte.risposta: are no more under their parents' control
